meanings.definition: To direct or divert (something) in a wrong or inappropriate way.
meanings.sent1: She kept mischannelling the conversation, making everyone confused.
meanings.sent2: The plumber mischannelling the pipe caused a big leak in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: By mischannelling the ingredients, the chef accidentally made a sweet soup instead of a savory stew.
meanings.sent4: His mischannelling of funds led to a financial disaster for the company.
meanings.sent5: The mischannelling of traffic during rush hour created chaos on the streets.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent1: The mischannelling of the package resulted in it being delivered to the wrong address.
meanings.sent2: She realized the mischannelling of the email caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent3: The mischannelling of the river diverted its flow towards the wrong path.
meanings.sent4: The mischannelling of the satellite signal led to a loss of communication.
meanings.sent5: The mischannelling of the train track caused a delay in the schedule.
